data.name: Condensate
description: Condensate is a liquid byproduct of natural gas production. It is a mixture of hydrocarbons that are liquid at normal surface temperatures and pressures. It is a natural gas liquid (NGL) that is used to make gasoline and other fuels.

data.name: LPG
description: Liquefied petroleum gas or liquid petroleum gas (LPG or LP gas), is a flammable mixture of hydrocarbon gases used as fuel in heating appliances, cooking equipment, and vehicles.

data.name: LNG
description: Liquefied natural gas (LNG) is natural gas that has been cooled to a liquid state, at about -260° Fahrenheit, for shipping and storage. The volume of natural gas in its liquid state is about 600 times smaller than its volume in its gaseous state. This process makes it possible to transport natural gas to places pipelines do not reach.

data.name: Kerosene
description: Kerosene, also known as paraffin, lamp oil, and coal oil (an obsolete term), is a combustible hydrocarbon liquid which is derived from petroleum. It is widely used as a fuel in aviation as well as households.

data.name: Petrochemicals
description: Petrochemicals are chemical products derived from petroleum or natural gas, playing a crucial role in various industries such as plastics, fertilizers, pharmaceuticals, and textiles. These compounds are essential for manufacturing a wide range of everyday products, from synthetic materials to detergents and packaging. The petrochemical industry in the UAE is a key driver of the economy, contributing to the region's industrial growth and diversification efforts. With advancements in technology, the sector has grown exponentially, ensuring a sustainable supply of essential chemicals for global industries.
